One idea to overcome jealousy when writing a screenplay for a feature film is to focus on your own unique style and voice. Instead of comparing yourself to others, try to develop your own unique perspective and approach to storytelling. This can help you to stand out and create something truly original.

Another idea is to practice self-compassion and remind yourself that everyone has their own strengths and weaknesses. Just because someone else finished their task seamlessly doesn't mean that you can't do the same. Take time to reflect on your own progress and celebrate your accomplishments, no matter how small they may be.

A third idea is to seek out feedback and constructive criticism from others. While it can be difficult to hear criticism, it can also be a valuable tool for growth and improvement. By seeking out feedback, you can gain insight into areas where you may need to improve and develop strategies to overcome any obstacles.

A fourth idea is to practice mindfulness and stay present in the moment. When you're feeling jealous, it's easy to get caught up in negative thoughts and comparisons. By staying present and focusing on your own journey, you can reduce stress and increase your productivity.

A fifth idea is to take breaks and prioritize self-care. Writing a screenplay can be a challenging and time-consuming task, and it's important to take care of yourself along the way. By taking breaks and prioritizing self-care, you can reduce stress and improve your overall well-being, which can ultimately lead to more creative and productive work.
